cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Harvey is tracking north-northwest, then turning northwest and slowing, on course toward the middle Texas coast where it is forecast to stall through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi/Port O’Connor, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches presently issued for the Louisiana coast; interests advised to monitor
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Matagorda TX; Tropical-Storm Warning north of Matagorda to High Island TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast Port Mansfield to High Island; storm-surge 1–3 ft possible High Island TX to Morgan City LA (includes southwest LA coast)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible late Friday night through Sunday (28% cumulative chance, peak probabilities Sunday–Monday).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along the southwest Louisiana coast, including Calcasieu Pass and the approaches to Lake Charles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–12 inches of rain possible over southwest Louisiana with locally higher totals, creating high risk of freshwater flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged rainfall/freshwater flooding, possible port access channel shoaling, and disruptions to ground transport logistics.
